pages.text: The Volcanic Accumulator generates mana by consuming Blazing Archwood, or passively based on the number of Lava source blocks underneath it. As the Volcanic Accumulator produces mana, it also produces $(item)heat$(), used for spawning Lava Lilies and converting stone into lava. The Volcanic Accumulator automatically outputs to nearby jars, starting with the one closest to it.

pages.title: Active Generation
pages.text: Nearby Blazing Archwood items will be burned up in exchange for a chunk of mana and a moderate amount of $(item)heat$().

pages.title: Passive Generation
pages.text: Lava in the 3x3 space beneath the Accumulator will generate mana passively. Each source block will provide an additional bonus mana and a small amount of $(item)heat$().

pages.title: Heat
pages.text: The Volcanic Accumulator will occasionally convert Stone into Magma Blocks, and Magma Blocks into Lava, given that these blocks exist beneath it in its 3x3 area. This conversion is dependent on the amount of $(item)heat$() it has produced over time. The Volcanic Accumulator will also spawn a Lava Lily adjacent to it given that there is nothing covering the lava. Lava Lilys may be harvested and used for decoration.
The color of a Lava Lily changes if it is placed above lava, magma, or other blocks.
